intro: Sarcolobus quinquangularis, commonly known as the five-angled spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, five-angled stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has alternate, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland ecosystems. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
